faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions - Sea Freight
faq.q1: What is the difference between FCL and LCL?
faq.a1: FCL (Full Container Load): you rent a full container (20' or 40') exclusively for your goods. LCL (Less than Container Load): your goods share a container with other shippers, ideal for small volumes.
faq.q2: Which documents are required for sea freight?
faq.a2: Commercial invoice, packing list, Bill of Lading, certificate of origin if required, and documents specific to the nature of the goods (health certificates, etc.).
faq.q3: How can I track my container in transit?
faq.a3: We provide a tracking number and access to our web platform for real-time tracking from loading at the departure port to arrival at the destination port.

final.title: Ready to ship by sea?
final.text: Get your personalized quote in under 24 hours. Our experts analyze your needs and propose the most cost-effective maritime solution.
